svcsubsec.title: ROOF CLEARANCE AND MARKER OR SUNSHADE LIGHTS

svcproc.title: CIRCUIT FUNCTIONS

figure.caption: Roof Clearance and Marker or Sunshade Lights Function Diagram

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. HEADLIGHT PARK LIGHT SWITCH (MOUNTED ON ELECTRONIC GAUGE CLUSTER)
4. CAB ROOF CLEARANCE AND MARKER OR SUNSHADE LIGHTS

svcproc.para: Refer to the Roof Clearance and Marker or Sunshade Lights Function Diagram.

note.para:
The clearance or sunshade lights are connected to the park lamp circuits in the ESC. If clearance lights and park lamps are inoperative refer to the Marker, Park and Tail lamps section
of this manual. If the clearance lights are inoperative but the park lights are working, proceed with this section.

svcproc.para: The standard cab roof clearance and marker lights are part of the basic cab design. If a sunshade is installed, the 5 lights are located in the sunshade.
The lights are activated when the headlight switch is in the headlight or park position. The electronic gauge cluster will send a message to the ESC to command the lights on.

The marker interrupt switch will also affect operation of the marker lights, park lights and clearance lights. The lights will turn on while the switch is held on, if the lights were previously off. The lights will turn off while the switch is held on, if the lights were previously on.
The ESC supplies battery voltage to the roof lights, marker and identification lights.
